content:

comments.content:
[http://www.lynda.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018074014/http:/www.lynda.com/)

use indesign. use justification and leading. either this is a very elementary question or im missing something.

Thanks.

I'll have to look up how to use them as I only purchased a few days ago.
2-column textbox and, as Nachos says, use the justified setting for your paragraphs.

There is something very wrong with that setting, random characters have jumped lines, I suspect the preferences need altering and/or look at hidden characters.

Tim

The sample is taken from [Kris Sowersby](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018074014/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Kris%20Sowersby)’s [Newzald specimen](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018074014/http:/www.klim.co.nz/newzald_samples.php). While it might work for the purpose of presenting a typeface and its colour, Tim is has a point: the even spacing is accomplished at the expense of language (see _Stewart Islan-d_).
